text: focus foods is going to bring urban
aquaponics to cities across the country
aquaponics is a nearly closed-loop
sustainable system for growing fruits
fish and vegetables we'll be building
urban farms inside greenhouses on top of
the roofs of grocery stores and selling
what we grow to the grocery stores so
we'll also be eliminating all
transportation and distribution costs
and emissions
i believe focus food will have two
impacts i think the biggest one will be
through environmental sustainability
agriculture today is very harmful to our
environment through greenhouse gas
emissions soil erosion pesticide use and
rampant water use
aquaponics and focused foods will
address all of these problems giving us
a sustainable way to source our food
i think we'll also have a public health
impact
produce can lose up to 77 of its vitamin
c in just a single week
and since our food is traveling 4200
miles on average to get to us this isn't
a long period of time
our food will go from harvest to sale
within hours so our vegetables and
fruits will have all of their nutrients
i think the hbs social enterprise
competition was a huge support one of
the ways was through feedback so we get
written feedback across all of the
rounds and even instant feedback as
semi-finalists and that feedback was
extremely helpful in pushing me to
really focus on my public health message
and hone that some more so that i can
have a greater impact i think one of the
most important things i'm taking away is
the exposure harvard has a tremendous
platform for really getting businesses
out there and i think through that
exposure we'll be able to get more
customers and more funding and grow so
that we can make the world a better
place
